definition: Tokugawa, the ruling clan of Japan from 1550-1850
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China

sentences.english: In what ways was the coming of Perry a turning point in late Tokugawa history?
sentences.chinese: 培理叩關在哪些方面是德川幕府晚期歷史的轉捩點？

sentences.english: Tokugawa flow of small and large Mamoud of this world are the reason for the large.
sentences.chinese: 小德川流，大德敦化，此天地之所以爲大也。

sentences.english: The thieves bride-kidnapping sunflower blackmail to tokugawa, but get away but met are dragon.
sentences.chinese: 小偷們欲擄走葵花訛詐德川，但逃走時卻遇上正龍。

sentences.english: During the Tokugawa period (1603-1867), the daimyo acted as local rulers in three-fourths of the country.
sentences.chinese: 德川幕府時代，大名在國內三個地區任地方統治者。

sentences.english: The Tokugawa shogunate arose after over a century of civil war.
sentences.chinese: 經過了一個世紀的內戰，德川幕府粉墨登場。

sentences.english: But when sunflower separated, tokugawa will anger let out.
sentences.chinese: 但當葵花分開後，德川終將怒氣發泄出來。

definition: ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
a member of the same clan/a distant relative with the same family name
TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi (1536-1598), Japanese warlord, undisputed ruler of Japan 1590-1598
(orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
